Description_lang: This booming coastal city is run by Baron Revilgaz of the Blackwater Raiders.  Mortal enemies of the Bloodsail Buccaneers and part of the Steamwheedle Cartel.
This Alliance capital is the pride of the Dun Morogh dwarves.  Home to King Magni.
The former denizens of Gnomeregan, now living in exile in Ironforge and in league with the Alliance.
The dwarves of the Thorium Brotherhood epitomize excellence in craftsmanship and are bent on unlocking the secrets of Blackrock Mountain.
Led by Sylvanas Windrunner, the Forsaken have joined a tenuous alliance with the Horde and established this capital in the vast depths under the Ruins of Lordaeron.
The Alliance capital is populated by Night Elves and is located in the island of Teldrassil.  Ruled by the Priestess of the Moon, Tyrande Whisperwind.
A primarily human criminal organization that operates mostly out of the Alterac Mountains and Hillsbrad Foothills.
One of the last bastions of human power, this Alliance capital is ruled by the child king, Anduin Wrynn.
Founded by Thrall, this Horde capital city is home to many of the proud orc clans of Durotar.
Cairne Bloodhoof leads his people, the Proud Tauren, from this mighty Horde capital.
These bloodthirsty corsairs are the bane of many a merchant in the high seas.  Sworn enemies of Booty Bay.
These centaur have made their home in the southern region of Desolace.  Mortal enemies of the Magram Centaur.
These centaur have made their home in the eastern region of Desolace.  Mortal enemies of the Gelkis Centaur.
These trolls have come to Yojamba Isle in an effort to recruit help against the resurrected Blood God and his Atal'ai Priests in Zul'Gurub.
This guild of thieves and assassins welcomes only those of extraordinary prowess into its fold.  Sworn rivals of the Syndicate.
Capital of the Steamwheedle Cartel and home to goblinhood's finest engineers, alchemists and merchants.
Part of the Steamwheedle Cartel, this goblin city provides a neutral haven for those that wish to trade goods and services in the Barrens.
Though not a part of the Alliance, the dwarves of Aerie Peak have opened their doors to it and hold the Horde as enemies.
The League of Arathor seeks to reclaim lost land of Arathi Basin for their benefactors in Stormwind.
The Defilers seek to claim Arathi Basin's valuable resources for the Horde.
An organization focused on protecting Azeroth from the threat of the Scourge.  Strongholds of the Argent Dawn can be found in the Eastern and Western Plaguelands.
This tribe of exiled trolls has joined forces with Thrall and the Horde.  They now call Durotar their home, which they share with their orc allies.
As the last uncorrupted furbolg tribe, the Timbermaw seek to preserve their spiritual ways and end the suffering of their brethren.
This trading post is run by the goblins of the Steamwheedle Cartel and it sits in the crossroads of Winterspring's main trade routes.
This small group of reclusive night elves raises and trains wintersabers in the Winterspring area.
The druids of Cenarion Circle are guardians of nature and make their home in tranquil Moonglade.
The Frostwolf Clan seeks to drive out the dwarves of the Stormpike Expedition from Alterac Valley.
The Stormpike Dwarves have set up residence in Alterac Valley, where they're locked in battle with the Frostwolf Orcs.
These elementals have made their home on the islands east of Azshara.  Sworn enemies of the armies of Ragnaros.
A remnant of the once powerful elves living in Dire Maul, yet still wise and knowledgeable about great secrets.
Fierce orcs of the Warsong Clan, locked in battle against the Silverwing Sentinels in Warsong Gulch.
Staunch defenders of Ashenvale, locked in battle against the Warsong Outriders in Warsong Gulch.
A traveling fair that showcases the weird and the extraordinary.  Often spotted in Elwynn Forest and Mulgore.
The descendants of the Bronze Dragonflight are the guardians of time and care little for the mortal races.
This faction only exists to test the editing of faction names and descriptions...
